stories.text: Let's say I have a blog(or a site like Stackoverflow). I have content being generated on a daily basis. How can I make sure that this content does not end up as training data for some big language model? Is there a specific license or legal terminology I can use? In case someone wants to use my content for training maybe I can ask them to pay me instead of using it up for free.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to stop AI scrapers from using my content as training data?
I have no natural desire for privacy. Can you sell me on protecting my data?

stories.text:
Weather apps nowadays seem to be less and less about data and just about looking nice. I was frustrated by this so I wrote Frej (from the Norse god of fair weather). https://apps.apple.com/se/app/frej/id1566974295?l=en

You can instantly see the weather for the entire day (24h) in two circles of 12h each. A yellow arc shows when the sun is up. A blue arc when present shows rainfall, with a thicker line meaning lots of rain.

Weather data is supplied by Open-Meteo (https://open-meteo.com/) which I found out about via a Show HN.

The source code is on Github: https://github.com/boxed/frej
stories.title: Show HN: Frej – iOS weather app as analog clocks
